cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 275 mi ENE of Tampico, Mexico / 255 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift north-northeast through Saturday, slow and turn westward over the weekend, then approach the central Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast, likely between Freeport and Port O’Connor

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coastline from the Mouth of the Rio Grande northward to the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) have a 42% cumulative chance of affecting the port, peaking early next week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Slow-moving system could drive 2–4 ft of surge along the upper Texas coast and within Galveston Bay if it nears landfall as forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from the slow system could easily deliver 4–8 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, producing flash-flood concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Building surf and dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend will hamper vessel movements and lighter-age operations.
